06-21-2007, 05:49 PM OzzyRules Senior Member 2,440 posts, read 3,826,759 times Reputation: 767 You should report it to management when that happens. Even if it's just a few pennies which I couldn't care less about, it's very poor customer service.
What I like is the opposite, like when they owe you 47 cents but they just give you the full 50 cents. That's good service.
06-21-2007, 06:24 PM slaleman you catch more files with honey... Location: San Antonio, TX 545 posts, read 1,266,142 times Reputation: 192 See, I'll tip at Sonic because they're running to food to you as opposed to just handing it out the window or over the counter. I worked at Wendy's when I was in high school and college, busted my butt all the time, cleaned all the nasty stuff, worked really late closing shifts, hell I even mowed the grass from time to time, and never expected a penny more from the customers than they were supposed to pay. And I only started out at $3.35/hr.
Now, when I ran pizzas in college, I did expect a little tip...not much. I always hoped to average out to $1 per delivery at the end of the night. It was a college town, and I knew as a college student myself that it wasn't easy to scrounge up the cash for pizza AND beer.
But, come on, setting out a tip jar at the Chinese pickup place, or an ice cream joint...that's a little much. I'm sorry if I sound like a jerk here, but if you have to live on minimum wage, that's your problem. As an educator, I see kids all the time who have the potential to go places if they'd just apply themselves the tiniest bit, but I see them years later working at Mickey D's because it's ALL THEY CAN DO. I don't feel sorry for them, and I'm sure as hell not going to tip them to push some buttons, turn around and grab my Big Mac.
Let the flames begin....
